event.title: ranked Columbus 11th on its historic destinations list in late 2008

data.event: National Geographic Traveler ranked Columbus 11th on its historic destinations list in late 2008, describing the city as "authentic, unique, and unspoiled."

event.title: won the national contest "America in Bloom" in 2006

data.event: Columbus won the national contest "America in Bloom" in 2006, and in 2004 it was named one of "The Ten Most Playful Towns" by Nick Jr.
Columbus won the national contest "America in Bloom" in 2006, and in 2004 it was named one of "The Ten Most Playful Towns" by Nick Jr.
The land which is now Columbus was bought by General John Tipton and Luke Bonesteel in 1820.

event.title: was changed to Columbus on March 20, 1821

data.event: The town's name was changed to Columbus on March 20, 1821.
